definition[0]: if someone deals with things one, three, ten etc at a time, they deal with them separately or in groups of three, ten etc
example[0]: If you raise your hands, I’ll answer questions one at a time.
example[1]: Frank took the stairs two at a time.
definition[1]: if something happens for hours, days, months etc at a time, it continues for several hours, months etc
example[2]: Because of his work, he’s often away for weeks at a time.
